Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas Rangers lost 94 games last season but won the pennant this year.
Adolis García hit a record-10 total bases in Game 7 with two homers and two singles that produced five runs batted in, boosting his series total to a record-15 RBIs.
The pitch that was not intentional turned the ALCS upside down.
Adolis García was put on the baseball street twice but is now the ALCS MVP two years later.
García was booed fiercely in Game 6 after a controversial pitch incident but hit a grand slam in the ninth inning of Game 6.
Others: The Rangers are a fast-break basketball team of an offense, scoring in bunches quickly.
The Rangers' offense is deep, and their pitchers accounted for 65% of Texas's innings in the ALCS.
Michael Young observed that the Rangers were confident and ready to 'bury' the Astros in Game 7.
